I am writing this review as a High School Student for an academic project. I've haven been using this app for my Physics and English classes, among other subjects. It was simple adding other courses and viewing what the teacher had posted on some occasions. I was around 15 years old when I was using this app. For that age, I couldn't figure out what needed to be done and what assignments were due. I used Schoology on a laptop, so it was always in a web form. In the web form, I found it to be too cluttered to navigate the site. A lot of information was displayed simultaneously. While some assignments were in folders, the folders often didn't show in the list feature which displayed the assignments that were due. In addition, in some assignments teachers posted a picture, but the picture wouldn't be shown due to some errors in the system in Schoology. If these problems would be handled, it would make the website much easier to use. Thank you for your time, expecting greater things. Thank you.
Its an amazing app, the only one thing ill suggest is making it look like the apple version
Love this app, I have never had any issues

Terrible. It showed the login page and when i logged in, then just showed a white screen! Then when I clicked the link on the bottom to try to log in that way it said "Invalid." I use a Samsung Galaxy S8. Please make your app comply with other electronic brands besides Apple and desktop.
Doesn't let me sign in. Continuously tells me I put the wrong password in when I triple checked and it was the right one. Pls get this fixed.

It's essentially non-functional. Cannot navigate through courses, unable to download files. When you tap on a folder, the app navigates to the same folder you were already in. Useless. I have to try and use the full site on my phone in a browser, which is frustrating. This, by the way, is both a parent using it for his two school-age children, and an educator using it to teach students.

Possibly the the most poorly organized and implemented application I've ever used on any device.. Most of the content is just their web site shoved into a frame, except things like links in posts don't work, and there is no way to navigate through content - the back button always exits the app. Trying to use messages crashes the application completely. Galaxy S8+

This app is very good on iOS, but the app is literal garbage on Android. The layout is horrendous and everything is broken, I can't view some materials in some folders when I know there are materials in there. It just kicks me out of that folder. It's extremely annoying and they need to redo this app on Android and stop focusing too much on their app for iOS. This app is a waste of time trying to use it on Android, but if you have an iPhone or iPad, it works pretty well.

This app is terrible!! No matter what I do, it always says my password is incorrect the first time. It makes me sign in twice before it recognizes me. When I use the app, the screen says "it looks like you are using you phone to access schoology, try downloading the app!" I AM ON THE APP!!! So I click on "download app" and it takes me to the play store and it says it's already downloaded. Terrible waste of time app.

It worked great the first time i had to use it my sophomore year, but we have to change our password every semester and ever since the first change it wont let me long into the app, i can log into the website just fine but the app wont let me. Im starting my senior year now and it still wont let me log in, it tells me that my email or password is wrong even though i know i know its right because i log in on the website.

I am a student using this app. my conclusion after using this app for one semester is that, the functionality and learned curve is good. Its easy to use and fairly simple. However I found that the app design is very dated and clunky. If the app gets updated I believe it could be one of the best tools for a school to have.

Recently, my school has adopted Schoology as a method of taking stress off of both the students and the teachers. Now, you'd think a mobile app for such a service would be easily navigated and would be easier to use than the site, right? What you end up getting is a UI that looks and functions horribly. The best part: The app from the students view is much different than the parental view! The parental side of the app is much more concise and usable, unlike the student side. Just use the website

Grade average not shown in app. The app is really slow and complicated. Everytime you try to submit a file for submission, you only can select one file each time, not allowing you to select multiple files in at once. The design also looks very outdated.

This app needs a lot of work. When I'm in the app dont tell me I need to download the app to open a pdf. Open the pdf in whatever tool opens the pdf on the phone. Navigation is a disaster. Wish it had a more modern, easy feel. There's features you can access on the desktop version, like class roster, that the app version doesn't include. Make the grades page easier to navigate, too! It's 2019, please and thank you.

Very limited functionality. Does not do as much as the desktop site does. This may be problematic for people that do not always have access to a desktop computer like myself. What features are there work well though.

Not mobile friendly at all. Does not rotate to read information provided by teachers must scroll each line left to right to read. Very difficult to navigate and not designed for parents. Almost useless app. You can look at things but don't try to create/edit an assignment or submit work as a student. Go to a desktop computer or a laptop to do any real work. The Schoology app is very useful for me to easily pull up my home updates dashboard on my phone when I don't have access to a computer or even just on the fly. It has most features,  but some are hard to access or don't work very often. For example, discussions that aren't in the regular updates section don't always work, and for me to be able to see my teachers' comments on my assignments also doesn't always work. Despite these flaws, I would say this is a very useful and functional app. I would recommend it.

The app does not load most important things like the syllabus, lecture material, and etc.  Concept is great, but what it delivers is very poor. I wish there was a different app to use.  I can say that this app is much better on the iPhone.  Please fix!!!

This app is absolutely trash. Here's some more details, since you asked.  1 - This is not an app. It's a poor implementation of a web browser hooked to some cheap side-menu links that do not work.  2 - The user has to enter their user information and password over and over, because the app doesn't remember it, because as I mentioned in #1, it's not actually an app, it's a web browser.  3 - It is not even a good web browser wrapper, because the pages it redirects to are not designed for a phone, they're designed for a computer.  4 - When the links do occasionally work, the webpages that it brings up are either zoomed out so much they are unreadable, or zoomed in so much that tables are not displayed correctly, making it unusable.  5 - Many in-site links do not work either. I clicked on a "read comments" link, and the iframe that came up in the browser wanted my logon information. Again.  Please have your developer sit down with a good book on Android app development, and actually write an app. Considering how much my school district pays for Schoology, we deserve better than this.

THANKS  Latest Problem I found..  #### When I embed a video in Schoology, in the HTML I have allowed FULL SCREEN MODE.. On my android phone. I hit the full screen icon on the video. It just gave me a black screen.. IT should show the video in LANDSCAPE FULL SCREEN MODE .. Please advise what i need to do to make this work..  Thanks...  #####. GROUPs Should also PROVIDE similar features  LIKE THE COURSE MODULE.. AUDIO RECORDING FEATURE IS NEEDED TO MAKE IT A MORE ATTRACTIVE AND FUN WAY OF INTERACTING.. @@@@ SEE FEATURES IN SEESAW CLASS SOFTWARE@@@@  First of all, the system technically is quite good.. EXCEPT for the following:   1. BLUE SYSTEM Color is VERY DULL AND BORING.  2. Is there a way to list all the courses on A single page so students can choose which one they wish to join?  I am setting up workshops instead of standard classes..  4. Discussion items need to have its own picture displayed alongside the title.. This will make it much more interesting for the students to ENGAGE..  Best Regards, Simon

So I'm in Precalculus, and my school uses schoology. On schoology, my teacher has an "Assignment List," which is a list of homework assignments and upcoming tests. One of the assignments is a worksheet, which when selected on the mobile browser gives the notification, "This cannot be displayed." It then suggests downloading the schoology app in order to view it. However, after finding my class on the app, clicking on the assignment list simply takes me back to the page on chrome, where, after finding the worksheet again, it tells me that it can't be displayed, and that I should download the app in order to view it. 5 stars if you can do something about this, the app is much more convenient than going to the web page every time. This is just an issue I've had.
